content.raw: Yes. We moved forward and now the issue is to run several times the sensor manager update function in the same test, we don’t have any issues between the tests now. I tested it today and the Update function from GpuLidar is not being called in line 581. I am double checking if the issue is on the GpuLidarSensor just in case.
content.html: Yes. We moved forward and now the issue is to run several times the sensor manager update function in the same test, we don’t have any issues between the tests now. I tested it today and the Update function from GpuLidar is not being called in line 581. I am double checking if the issue is on the GpuLidarSensor just in case.

content.raw:
Ok, I tested this with [Ogre2GpuRays](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/128/add-ogre2gpurays-sensor/diff) branch from ignition rendering and now it works with gpu\_lidar using ogre2 :slight_smile:   
  
Once merged `use_ogre2` branch we can merge this.
content.html:
Ok, I tested this with Ogre2GpuRays branch from ignition rendering and now it works with gpu_lidar using ogre2

Once merged use_ogre2 branch we can merge this.

update.description: Add gpu lidar sensor using Ignition Rendering Gpu Rays class.
update.title: Add gpu lidar sensor

content.raw:
Yes, I am already looking at using Ogre 2.1 for the cameras. But I also tested really fast what Ian suggested and it worked, partially at least since moving objects seems not to be working properly, so I left the TODO’s there.  
  
I will stop here but also suggest to merge this PR if you see that the PR doesn’t require a lot of changes. I will focus on Ogre 2.1 in ign-rendering as you suggested.  
  
Also if we use ignition rendering API with ogre 2.1 and ogre 1.9, then this test should work for both rendering engines too. That is also included in the gpu\_rays, where the test itself is based on the tests used in ign-rendering \(although it doesn’t include the changes required in the latest [ogre2\_tests](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/115/enable-ogre2-tests/diff) branch\).
content.html:
Yes, I am already looking at using Ogre 2.1 for the cameras. But I also tested really fast what Ian suggested and it worked, partially at least since moving objects seems not to be working properly, so I left the TODO’s there.

I will stop here but also suggest to merge this PR if you see that the PR doesn’t require a lot of changes. I will focus on Ogre 2.1 in ign-rendering as you suggested.

Also if we use ignition rendering API with ogre 2.1 and ogre 1.9, then this test should work for both rendering engines too. That is also included in the gpu_rays, where the test itself is based on the tests used in ign-rendering (although it doesn’t include the changes required in the latest ogre2_tests branch).

content.raw: @JChoclin , can we put this PR on ice for a bit? We don't need ogre1.x  gpu_lidar for subt. Instead, can you look at using Ogre2.1 for 2d cameras?
content.html: @JChoclin , can we put this PR on ice for a bit? We don't need ogre1.x gpu_lidar for subt. Instead, can you look at using Ogre2.1 for 2d cameras?

content.raw: maybe try testing it with the new ign-rendering changes that support unloading rendering engines at the end of each test, i.e. `rendering::unloadEngine(engine->Name())`?
content.html: maybe try testing it with the new ign-rendering changes that support unloading rendering engines at the end of each test, i.e. rendering::unloadEngine(engine->Name())?

content.raw:
This PR is still having issues with moving the objects or running several tests so many checks are commented like [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/23/add-gpu-lidar-sensor/diff#Ltest/integration/gpu_lidar_sensor_plugin.ccT547). Currently the test has only the first test running almost complete.   
  
After that it looks like the scene is not updated properly. If the first one is commented then the second one works fine but the issue is still there for the third one. This is similar to [the issue I had with gpu\_rays](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/issues/33/clean-properly-after-each-test) class in ignition rendering, but in this case the test for ignition rendering is working just fine in the same container, but the issue re appears for ignition sensors. Am I missing something with the sensors manager? Any ideas @nkoenig @iche033 ?
content.html:
This PR is still having issues with moving the objects or running several tests so many checks are commented like here. Currently the test has only the first test running almost complete.

After that it looks like the scene is not updated properly. If the first one is commented then the second one works fine but the issue is still there for the third one. This is similar to the issue I had with gpu_rays class in ignition rendering, but in this case the test for ignition rendering is working just fine in the same container, but the issue re appears for ignition sensors. Am I missing something with the sensors manager? Any ideas @nkoenig @iche033 ?
